   20: -module(epp_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: 
   24: -export([rec_1/1, include_local/1, predef_mac/1,
   25: 	 upcase_mac_1/1, upcase_mac_2/1,
   26: 	 variable_1/1, otp_4870/1, otp_4871/1, otp_5362/1,
   27:          pmod/1, not_circular/1, skip_header/1, otp_6277/1, gh_4995/1, otp_7702/1,
   28:          otp_8130/1, overload_mac/1, otp_8388/1, otp_8470/1,
   29:          otp_8562/1, otp_8665/1, otp_8911/1, otp_10302/1, otp_10820/1,
   30:          otp_11728/1, encoding/1, extends/1,  function_macro/1,
   31: 	 test_error/1, test_warning/1, otp_14285/1,
   32: 	 test_if/1,source_name/1,otp_16978/1,otp_16824/1,scan_file/1,file_macro/1,
   33:          deterministic_include/1, nondeterministic_include/1,
   34:          gh_8268/1,
   35:          moduledoc_include/1,
   36:          stringify/1
   37:         ]).
   38: 
   39: -export([epp_parse_erl_form/2]).
   40: 
   41: %%
   42: %% Define to run outside of test server
   43: %%
   44: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   45: 
   46: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   47: -compile(export_all).
   48: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   49: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   50: %% -define(t, test_server).
   51: -define(t, io).
   52: config(priv_dir, _) ->
   53:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_priv");
   54: config(data_dir, _) ->
   55:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_data").
   56: -else.
   57: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   58: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   59: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   60: 
   61: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   65:     ok.
   66: -endif.
   67: 
   68: suite() ->
   69:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   70:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   71: 
   72: all() ->
   73:     [rec_1, {group, upcase_mac}, include_local, predef_mac,
   74:      {group, variable}, otp_4870, otp_4871, otp_5362, pmod,
   75:      not_circular, skip_header, otp_6277, gh_4995, otp_7702, otp_8130,
   76:      overload_mac, otp_8388, otp_8470, otp_8562,
   77:      otp_8665, otp_8911, otp_10302, otp_10820, otp_11728,
   78:      encoding, extends, function_macro, test_error, test_warning,
   79:      otp_14285, test_if, source_name, otp_16978, otp_16824, scan_file, file_macro,
   80:      deterministic_include, nondeterministic_include,
   81:      gh_8268,
   82:      moduledoc_include,
   83:      stringify].
   84: 
   85: groups() ->
   86:     [{upcase_mac, [], [upcase_mac_1, upcase_mac_2]},
   87:      {variable, [], [variable_1]}].
   88: 
   89: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   90:     Config.
   91: 
   92: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   93:     ok.
   94: 
   95: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   96:     Config.
   97: 
   98: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   99:     Config.
  100: 
  101: %% Recursive macros hang or crash epp (OTP-1398).
  102: rec_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  103:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac.erl"),
  104:     {ok, List} = epp_parse_file(File, [], []),
  105:     %% we should encounter errors
  106:     {value, _} = lists:keysearch(error, 1, List),
  107:     check_errors(List),
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: include_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  111:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  112:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "include_local.erl"),
  113:     FooHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","foo.hrl"]),
  114:     BarHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","bar.hrl"]),
  115:     %% include_local.erl includes include/foo.hrl which
  116:     %% includes bar.hrl (also in include/) without requiring
  117:     %% any additional include path, and overriding any file
  118:     %% of the same name that the path points to
  119:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [DataDir], []),
  120:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{true,true}}} =
  121: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  122:     [{File,1},{FooHrl,1},{BarHrl,1},{FooHrl,5},{File,5}] =
  123:         [ FileLine || {attribute,_,file,FileLine} <- List ],
  124:     ok.
  125: 
  126: file_macro(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  127:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  128:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "file_macro.erl"),
  129:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  130:                                        {source_name, "Other source"}]),
  131:     %% Both attribute a and b are defined as ?FILE, they should be the same
  132:     {attribute,_,a,FileA} = lists:keyfind(a, 3, List),
  133:     {attribute,_,b,FileB} = lists:keyfind(b, 3, List),
  134:     "Other source" = FileA = FileB,
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: moduledoc_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  139:     ModuleFileContent = <<"-module(moduledoc).
  140: 
  141:                            -moduledoc {file, \"README.md\"}.
  142: 
  143:                            -export([]).
  144:                           ">>,
  145:     DocFileContent = <<"# README
  146: 
  147:                         This file is a test
  148:                        ">>,
  149:     CreateFile = fun (Dir, File, Content) ->
  150:                      Dirname = filename:join([PrivDir, Dir]),
  151:                      ok = create_dir(Dirname),
  152:                      Filename = filename:join([Dirname, File]),
  153:                      ok = file:write_file(Filename, Content),
  154:                      Filename
  155:                  end,
  156: 
  157:     %% positive test: checks that all works as expected
  158:     ModuleName = CreateFile("module_attr", "moduledoc.erl", ModuleFileContent),
  159:     DocName = CreateFile("module_attr", "README.md", DocFileContent),
  160:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(ModuleName, []),
  161:     {attribute, _, moduledoc, ModuleDoc} = lists:keyfind(moduledoc, 3, List),
  162:     ?assertEqual({ok, unicode:characters_to_binary(ModuleDoc)}, file:read_file(DocName)),
  163: 
  164:     %% negative test: checks that we produce an expected warning
  165:     ModuleWarnContent = binary:replace(ModuleFileContent, <<"README">>, <<"NotExistingFile">>),
  166:     ModuleWarnName = CreateFile("module_attr", "moduledoc_err.erl", ModuleWarnContent),
  167:     {ok, ListWarn} = epp:parse_file(ModuleWarnName, []),
  168:     {warning,{_,epp,{moduledoc,file, "NotExistingFile.md"}}} = lists:keyfind(warning, 1, ListWarn),
  169: 
  170:     ok.
  171: 
  172: create_dir(Dir) ->
  173:     case file:make_dir(Dir) of
  174:         ok -> ok;
  175:         {error, eexist} -> ok;
  176:         _ -> error
  177:     end.
  178: 
  179: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  180:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  181:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  182:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  183:                                        {deterministic, true},
  184:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  185: 
  186:     %% In deterministic mode, only basenames, rather than full paths, should
  187:     %% be written to the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  188:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  189:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"baz.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  190:                        (_) -> false
  191:                      end,
  192:                      List),
  193:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  194:             "including baz.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  195:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  196:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"file.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  197:                        (_) -> false
  198:                      end,
  199:                      List),
  200:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  201:             "including file.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  202:     ok.
  203: 
  204: nondeterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  205:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  206:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  207:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  208:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  209: 
  210:     %% Outside of deterministic mode, full paths, should be written to
  211:     %% the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  212:     %% to make debugging easier.
  213:     %% We don't try to assume what the full absolute path will be in the
  214:     %% unit test, since that can depend on the environment and how the
  215:     %% test is executed. Instead, we just look for whether there is
  216:     %% the parent directory along with the basename at least.
  217:     IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","baz.hrl"),
  218:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  219:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_Line}}) ->
  220:                          lists:suffix(IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  221:                        (_) -> false
  222:                      end,
  223:                      List),
  224:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  225:             "including baz.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  226:     IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","file.hrl"),
  227:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  228:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_line}}) ->
  229:                          lists:suffix(IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  230:                        (_) -> false
  231:                      end,
  232:                      List),
  233:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  234:             "including file.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  235:     ok.
  236: 
  237: %%% Here is a little reimplementation of epp:parse_file, which times out
  238: %%% after 4 seconds if the epp server doesn't respond. If we use the
  239: %%% regular epp:parse_file, the test case will time out, and then epp
  240: %%% server will go on growing until we dump core.
  241: epp_parse_file(File, Inc, Predef) ->
  242:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  243: 				     epp:open(File, Inc, Predef)
  244: 			     end),
  245:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  246: 				     Opts = [{name, File},
  247: 					     {includes, Inc},
  248: 					     {macros, Predef}],
  249: 				     epp:open(Opts)
  250: 			     end),
  251:     {ok, List}.
  252: 
  253: do_epp_parse_file(Open) ->
  254:     {ok, Epp} = Open(),
  255:     List = collect_epp_forms(Epp),
  256:     epp:close(Epp),
  257:     List.
  258: 
  259: collect_epp_forms(Epp) ->
  260:     Result = epp_parse_erl_form(Epp),
  261:     case Result of
  262: 	{error, _Error} ->
  263: 	    [Result | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  264: 	{ok, Form} ->
  265: 	    [Form | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  266: 	{eof, _} ->
  267: 	    [Result]
  268:     end.
  269: 
  270: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp) ->
  271:     P = spawn(?MODULE, epp_parse_erl_form, [Epp, self()]),
  272:     receive
  273: 	{P, Result} ->
  274: 	    Result
  275:     after 4000 ->
  276: 	    exit(Epp, kill),
  277: 	    exit(P, kill),
  278: 	    timeout
  279:     end.
  280: 
  281: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp, Parent) ->
  282:     Parent ! {self(), epp:parse_erl_form(Epp)}.
  283: 
  284: check_errors([]) ->
  285:     ok;
  286: check_errors([{error, Info} | Rest]) ->
  287:     {Line, Mod, Desc} = Info,
  288:     case Line of
  289: 	I when is_integer(I) -> ok;
  290: 	{L,C} when is_integer(L), is_integer(C), C >= 1 -> ok
  291:     end,
  292:     Str = lists:flatten(Mod:format_error(Desc)),
  293:     [Str] = io_lib:format("~s", [Str]),
  294:     check_errors(Rest);
  295: check_errors([_ | Rest]) ->
  296:     check_errors(Rest).
  297: 
  298: 
  299: upcase_mac_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  301:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  302:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  303:     Tuple = {1, 1, 3, 3},
  304:     ok.
  305: 
  306: upcase_mac_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  307:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  308:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], [{p, 5}, {'P', 6}]),
  309:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  310:     Tuple = {5, 5, 6, 6},
  311:     ok.
  312: 
  313: predef_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  314:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac3.erl"),
  315:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  316:     [_,
  317:      {attribute, Anno, l, Line1},
  318:      {attribute, _, f, File},
  319:      {attribute, _, machine1, _},
  320:      {attribute, _, module, mac3},
  321:      {attribute, _, m, mac3},
  322:      {attribute, _, ms, "mac3"},
  323:      {attribute, _, machine2, _}
  324:      | _] = List,
  325:     Line1 = erl_anno:line(Anno),
  326:     ok.
  327: 
  328: variable_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  329:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  330:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "variable_1.erl"),
  331:     true = os:putenv("VAR", DataDir),
  332:     %% variable_1.erl includes variable_1_include.hrl and
  333:     %% variable_1_include_dir.hrl.
  334:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  335:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{value1,value2}}} =
  336: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  337:     ok.
  338: 
  339: %% undef without module declaration.
  340: otp_4870(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  341:     Ts = [{otp_4870,
  342:            <<"-undef(foo).
  343:            ">>,
  344:            []}],
  345:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  346:     ok.
  347: 
  348: %% crashing erl_scan
  349: otp_4871(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  350:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  351:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_4871.erl"),
  352:     ok = file:write_file(File, "-module(otp_4871)."),
  353:     %% Testing crash in erl_scan. Unfortunately there currently is
  354:     %% no known way to crash erl_scan so it is emulated by killing the
  355:     %% file io server. This assumes lots of things about how
  356:     %% the processes are started and how monitors are set up,
  357:     %% so there are some sanity checks before killing.
  358:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  359:     timer:sleep(1),
  360:     true = current_module(Epp, epp),
  361:     {monitored_by,[Io]} = process_info(Epp, monitored_by),
  362:     true = current_module(Io, file_io_server),
  363:     exit(Io, emulate_crash),
  364:     timer:sleep(1),
  365:     {error,{_Line,epp,cannot_parse}} = otp_4871_parse_file(Epp),
  366:     epp:close(Epp),
  367:     ok.
  368: 
  369: current_module(Pid, Mod) ->
  370:     {current_function, {Mod, _, _}} = process_info(Pid, current_function),
  371:     true.
  372: 
  373: otp_4871_parse_file(Epp) ->
  374:     case epp:parse_erl_form(Epp) of
  375: 	{ok,_} -> otp_4871_parse_file(Epp);
  376: 	Other -> Other
  377:     end.
  378: 
  379: %% OTP-5362. The -file attribute is recognized.
  380: otp_5362(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  381:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  382: 
  383:     Copts = [return, strong_validation,{i,Dir}],
  384: 
  385:     File_Incl = filename:join(Dir, "incl_5362.erl"),
  386:     File_Incl2 = filename:join(Dir, "incl2_5362.erl"),
  387:     File_Incl3 = filename:join(Dir, "incl3_5362.erl"),
  388:     Incl = <<"-module(incl_5362).
  389: 
  390:               -include(\"incl2_5362.erl\").
  391: 
  392:               -include_lib(\"incl3_5362.erl\").
  393: 
  394:               hi(There) -> % line 7
  395:                    a.
  396:            ">>,
  397:     Incl2 = <<"-file(\"some.file\", 100).
  398: 
  399:                foo(Bar) -> % line 102
  400:                    foo.
  401:             ">>,
  402:     Incl3 = <<"glurk(Foo) -> % line 1
  403:                   bar.
  404:             ">>,
  405:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl, Incl),
  406:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl2, Incl2),
  407:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl3, Incl3),
  408: 
  409:     {ok, incl_5362, InclWarnings} = compile:file(File_Incl, Copts),
  410:     true = message_compare(
  411:                    [{File_Incl3,[{{1,1},erl_lint,{unused_function,{glurk,1}}},
  412:                                  {{1,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Foo'}}]},
  413:                     {File_Incl,[{{7,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{hi,1}}},
  414:                                 {{7,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'There'}}]},
  415:                     {"some.file",[{{102,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{foo,1}}},
  416:                                   {{102,20},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Bar'}}]}],
  417:                    lists:usort(InclWarnings)),
  418: 
  419:     file:delete(File_Incl),
  420:     file:delete(File_Incl2),
  421:     file:delete(File_Incl3),
  422: 
  423:     %% A -file attribute referring back to the including file.
  424:     File_Back = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.erl"),
  425:     File_Back_hrl = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.hrl"),
  426:     Back = <<"-module(back_5362).
  427: 
  428:               -export([foo/1]).
  429: 
  430:               -file(?FILE, 1).
  431:               -include(\"back_5362.hrl\").
  432: 
  433:               foo(V) -> % line 4
  434:                   bar.
  435:               ">>,
  436:     Back_hrl = [<<"
  437:                   -file(\"">>,File_Back,<<"\", 2).
  438:                  ">>],
  439: 
  440:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back, Back),
  441:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back_hrl, list_to_binary(Back_hrl)),
  442: 
  443:     {ok, back_5362, BackWarnings} = compile:file(File_Back, Copts),
  444:     true = message_compare(
  445:                    [{File_Back,[{{4,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'V'}}]}],
  446:                    BackWarnings),
  447:     file:delete(File_Back),
  448:     file:delete(File_Back_hrl),
  449: 
  450:     %% Set filename but keep line.
  451:     File_Change = filename:join(Dir, "change_5362.erl"),
  452:     Change = [<<"-module(change_5362).
  453: 
  454:                 -file(?FILE, 100).
  455: 
  456:                 -export([foo/1,bar/1]).
  457: 
  458:                 -file(\"other.file\", ?LINE). % like an included file...
  459:                 foo(A) -> % line 105
  460:                     bar.
  461: 
  462:                 -file(\"">>,File_Change,<<"\", 1000).
  463: 
  464:                 bar(B) -> % line 1002
  465:                     foo.
  466:               ">>],
  467: 
  468:     ok = file:write_file(File_Change, list_to_binary(Change)),
  469: 
  470:     {ok, change_5362, ChangeWarnings} =
  471:         compile:file(File_Change, Copts),
  472:     true = message_compare(
  473:                    [{File_Change,[{{1002,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]},
  474:                     {"other.file",[{{105,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}],
  475:                    lists:usort(ChangeWarnings)),
  476: 
  477:     file:delete(File_Change),
  478: 
  479:     %% -file attribute ending with a blank (not a newline).
  480:     File_Blank = filename:join(Dir, "blank_5362.erl"),
  481: 
  482:     Blank = <<"-module(blank_5362).
  483: 
  484:                -export([q/1,a/1,b/1,c/1]).
  485: 
  486:                -
  487:                file(?FILE, 18). q(Q) -> foo. % line 18
  488: 
  489:                a(A) -> % line 20
  490:                    1.
  491: 
  492:                -file(?FILE, 42).
  493: 
  494:                b(B) -> % line 44
  495:                    2.
  496: 
  497:                -file(?FILE, ?LINE). c(C) -> % line 47
  498:                    3.
  499:             ">>,
  500:     ok = file:write_file(File_Blank, Blank),
  501:     {ok, blank_5362, BlankWarnings} = compile:file(File_Blank, Copts),
  502:     true = message_compare(
  503:              [{File_Blank,[{{18,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}},
  504:                            {{20,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}},
  505:                            {{44,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  506:                            {{47,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C'}}]}],
  507:               lists:usort(BlankWarnings)),
  508:     file:delete(File_Blank),
  509: 
  510:     %% __FILE__ is set by inclusion and by -file attribute
  511:     FILE_incl = filename:join(Dir, "file_5362.erl"),
  512:     FILE_incl1 = filename:join(Dir, "file_incl_5362.erl"),
  513:     FILE = <<"-module(file_5362).
  514: 
  515:               -export([ff/0, ii/0]).
  516: 
  517:               -include(\"file_incl_5362.erl\").
  518: 
  519:               -file(\"other_file\", 100).
  520: 
  521:               ff() ->
  522:                   ?FILE.">>,
  523:     FILE1 = <<"ii() -> ?FILE.
  524:               ">>,
  525:     FILE_Mod = file_5362,
  526:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl, FILE),
  527:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl1, FILE1),
  528:     FILE_Copts = [return, {i,Dir},{outdir,Dir}],
  529:     {ok, file_5362, []} = compile:file(FILE_incl, FILE_Copts),
  530:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(FILE_incl, ".erl"),
  531:     {module, FILE_Mod} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, FILE_Mod),
  532:     II = FILE_Mod:ii(),
  533:     "file_incl_5362.erl" = filename:basename(II),
  534:     FF = FILE_Mod:ff(),
  535:     "other_file" = filename:basename(FF),
  536:     code:purge(file_5362),
  537: 
  538:     file:delete(FILE_incl),
  539:     file:delete(FILE_incl1),
  540: 
  541:     ok.
  542: 
  543: pmod(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  544:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  545:     Pmod = filename:join(DataDir, "pmod.erl"),
  546:     case epp:parse_file([Pmod], [], []) of
  547: 	      {ok,Forms} ->
  548: 		  %% io:format("~p\n", [Forms]),
  549: 		  [] = [F || {error,_}=F <- Forms],
  550: 		  ok
  551: 	  end,
  552:     ok.
  553: 
  554: not_circular(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  555:     %% Used to generate a compilation error, wrongly saying that it
  556:     %% was a circular definition.
  557: 
  558:     Ts = [{circular_1,
  559:            <<"-define(S(S), ??S).\n"
  560:              "t() -> \"string\" = ?S(string), ok.\n">>,
  561:            ok}],
  562:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  563:     ok.
  564: 
  565: %% Skip some bytes in the beginning of the file.
  566: skip_header(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  567:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  568:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "epp_test_skip_header.erl"]),
  569:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  570: 			       <<"some bytes
  571:                                   in the beginning of the file
  572:                                   that should be skipped
  573:                                   -module(epp_test_skip_header).
  574:                                   -export([main/1]).
  575: 
  576:                                   main(_) -> ?MODULE.
  577: 
  578:                                   ">>),
  579:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
  580:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  581:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  582:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  583:     {ok, Epp} = epp:open([{fd, Fd}, {name, list_to_atom(File)}, {location, 4}]),
  584: 
  585:     Forms = epp:parse_file(Epp),
  586:     [] = [Reason || {error, Reason} <- Forms],
  587:     ok = epp:close(Epp),
  588:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  589: 
  590:     ok.
  591: 
  592: %% ?MODULE before module declaration.
  593: otp_6277(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  594:     Ts = [{otp_6277,
  595:            <<"-undef(ASSERT).
  596:               -define(ASSERT, ?MODULE).
  597: 
  598:               ?ASSERT().">>,
  599:            [{error,{4,epp,{undefined,'MODULE', none}}}]}],
  600:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  601:     ok.
  602: 
  603: %% Test -ifdef(MODULE) before module declaration. Should not be
  604: %% considered defined.
  605: gh_4995(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  606:     Ts = [{gh_4995,
  607:            <<"-ifdef(MODULE).
  608:               -record(r, {x = ?MODULE}).
  609:               -endif.">>,
  610:            []}],
  611:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  612:     ok.
  613:

  615: otp_7702(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  616:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  617:     File = filename:join(Dir, "file_7702.erl"),
  618:     Contents = <<"-module(file_7702).
  619: 
  620:                   -export([t/0]).
  621: 
  622:                   -define(RECEIVE(Msg,Body),
  623:                        receive
  624:                            Msg -> Body;

  626:                 exit({unexpected_message,M,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  627:                        after 10000 ->
  628:                             exit({timeout,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  629:                        end).
  630:                    t() ->
  631:                        ?RECEIVE(foo, bar).">>,
  632:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents),

  634:         compile:file(File, [debug_info,return,{outdir,Dir}]),

  637:     {ok, AC} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),

  640:     Forms2 = unopaque_forms(Forms),

  653:                     [{atom,{14,38},unexpected_message},

  906:                     {{3,19},epp,{undefined,'A',none}}],[]}}

  913:             [{error,{2,epp,{depth,"include_lib"}}}]},
  914:

  917:             [{error,{2,epp,{depth,"include"}}}]}
  918:            ],

  922:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8130.erl"),
  923:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  924:                                "-module(otp_8130).\n"
  925:                                "-define(a, 3.14).\n"
  926:                                "t() -> ?a.\n"),
  927:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  928:     PreDefMacs = macs(Epp),
  929:     ['BASE_MODULE','BASE_MODULE_STRING','BEAM',
  930:      'FEATURE_AVAILABLE', 'FEATURE_ENABLED','FILE',
  931:      'FUNCTION_ARITY','FUNCTION_NAME',
  932:      'LINE','MACHINE','MODULE','MODULE_STRING',
  933:      'OTP_RELEASE'] = PreDefMacs,
  934:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,file}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  935:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,module}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  936:     {ok,[{atom,_,t}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  937:     {eof,_} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  938:     [a] = macs(Epp) -- PreDefMacs,
  939:     epp:close(Epp),
  940: 
  941:     %% escript
  942:     ModuleStr = "any_name",
  943:     Module = list_to_atom(ModuleStr),
  944:     fun() ->
  945:             PreDefMacros = [{'MODULE', Module, redefine},
  946:                             {'MODULE_STRING', ModuleStr, redefine},
  947:                             a, {b,2}],
  948:             {ok,Epp2} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros),
  949:             [{atom,_,true}] = macro(Epp2, a),
  950:             [{integer,_,2}] = macro(Epp2, b),
  951:             false = macro(Epp2, c),
  952:             epp:close(Epp2)
  953:     end(),
  954:     fun() ->
  955:             PreDefMacros = [{a,b,c}],
  956:             {error,{bad,{a,b,c}}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  957:     end(),
  958:     fun() ->
  959:             PreDefMacros = [a, {a,1}],
  960:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  961:     end(),
  962:     fun() ->
  963:             PreDefMacros = [{a,1},a],
  964:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  965:     end(),
  966: 
  967:     {error,enoent} = epp:open("no such file", []),
  968:     {error,enoent} = epp:parse_file("no such file", [], []),
  969: 
  970:     _ = ifdef(Config),
  971: 
  972:     ok.
  973: 
  974: scan_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  975:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  976:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
  977: 
  978:     {ok, Toks, [{encoding, _}]} = epp:scan_file(File, []),
  979:     [FileForm1, ModuleForm, ExportForm,
  980:      FileForm2, FileForm3, FunctionForm,
  981:      {eof,_}] = Toks,
  982:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ]   = FileForm1,
  983:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,module}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ModuleForm,
  984:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,export}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ExportForm,
  985:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ]   = FileForm2,
  986:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ]   = FileForm3,
  987:     [{atom,_,ok}, {'(',_} | _]               = FunctionForm,
  988:     ok.
  989: 
  990: macs(Epp) ->
  991:     Macros = epp:macro_defs(Epp), % not documented
  992:     lists:sort([MName || {{atom,MName},_} <- Macros]).
  993: 
  994: macro(Epp, N) ->
  995:     case lists:keyfind({atom,N}, 1, epp:macro_defs(Epp)) of
  996:         false -> false;
  997:         {{atom,N},{_,V}} -> V;
  998:         {{atom,N},Defs} -> lists:append([V || {_,{_,V}} <- Defs])
  999:     end.
 1000: 
 1001: ifdef(Config) ->
 1002:     Cs = [{ifdef_c1,
 1003:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1004:              "a bug.\n"
 1005:              "-else.\n"
 1006:              "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1007:              "a bug.\n"
 1008:              "-endif.\n"
 1009:              "-else.\n"
 1010:              "t() -> ok.\n"
 1011:              "-endif.">>,
 1012:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
 1013: 
 1014:           {ifdef_c2,
 1015:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
 1016:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
 1017:              "a bug.\n"
 1018:              "-endif.">>,
 1019:            {errors,[{{3,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","bug"]}],[]}},
 1020: 
 1021:           {ifdef_c3,
 1022:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
 1023:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
 1024:              "-endif">>,
 1025: 
 1026:            {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
 1027:                     {{3,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],
 1028:           []}},
 1029: 
 1030:           {ifdef_c4,
 1031:            <<"\n-ifdef a.\n"
 1032:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1033:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,ifdef}}],[]}},
 1034: 
 1035:           {ifdef_c5,
 1036:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1037:              "-else.\n"
 1038:              "-endif.\n"
 1039:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1040:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",endif}}],[]}},
 1041: 
 1042:           {ifdef_c6,
 1043:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1044:              "-else.\n"
 1045:              "-endif.\n"
 1046:              "-else.\n">>,
 1047:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'else'}}],[]}},
 1048:

 1051:              "-else\n"
 1052:              "foo bar\n"
 1053:              "-else.\n"
 1054:              "t() -> a.\n"
 1055:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1056:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,{bad,'else'}}],[]}},
 1057:

 1059:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1060:               "-foo bar.">>,
 1061:            {errors,[{{2,10},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],[]}},

 1065:               "3.3e12000.\n"
 1066:               "-endif.\n">>,
 1067:            []},
 1068:

 1070:            <<"\nt() -> 3.3e12000.\n">>,
 1071:            {errors,[{{2,8},erl_scan,{illegal,float}},
 1072:                     {{2,17},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}], % ...
 1073:             []}},
 1074:

 1076:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1077:              "-ifndef(A).\n"
 1078:              "t() -> ok.\n"
 1079:              "-endif.\n"
 1080:              "-else.\n"
 1081:              "a bug.\n"
 1082:              "-else.\n"
 1083:              "a bug.\n"
 1084:              "-endif.">>,
 1085:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},

 1089:              "-endif">>,

 1187: %% OTP-12847: Test the -error directive.
 1188: test_error(Config) ->
 1189:     Cs = [{error_c1,
 1190:            <<"-error(\"string and macro: \" ?MODULE_STRING).\n"
 1191: 	     "-ifdef(NOT_DEFINED).\n"
 1192: 	     " -error(\"this one will be skipped\").\n"
 1193: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1194:            {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{error,"string and macro: epp_test"}}],[]}},
 1195: 
 1196: 	  {error_c2,
 1197: 	   <<"-ifdef(CONFIG_A).\n"
 1198: 	     " t() -> a.\n"
 1199: 	     "-else.\n"
 1200: 	     "-ifdef(CONFIG_B).\n"
 1201: 	     " t() -> b.\n"
 1202: 	     "-else.\n"
 1203: 	     "-error(\"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available\").\n"
 1204: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1205: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1206: 	   {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{error,"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available"}}],[]}},
 1207: 
 1208: 	  {error_c3,
 1209: 	   <<"-error(a b c).\n">>,
 1210: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,error}}],[]}}
 1211: 
 1212: 	 ],
 1213: 
 1214:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1215:     ok.

 1247: %% OTP-12847: Test the -if and -elif directives and the built-in
 1248: %% function defined(Symbol).
 1249: test_if(Config) ->
 1250:     Cs = [{if_1c,
 1251: 	   <<"-if.\n"
 1252: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1253: 	     "-if no_parentheses.\n"
 1254: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1255: 	     "-if(syntax error.\n"
 1256: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1257: 	     "-if(true).\n"
 1258: 	     "-if(a+3).\n"
 1259: 	     "syntax error not triggered here.\n"
 1260: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1261:            {errors,[{{1,23},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1262: 		    {{3,5},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1263: 		    {{5,12},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","error"]},
 1264: 		    {{11,1},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",'if'}}],
 1265: 	    []}},
 1266: 
 1267: 	  {if_2c,			       	%Bad guard expressions.
 1268: 	   <<"-if(is_list(integer_to_list(42))).\n" %Not guard BIF.
 1269: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1270: 	     "-if(begin true end).\n"
 1271: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1272: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1273: 		    {{3,2},epp,{bad,'if'}}],
 1274: 	    []}},
 1275: 
 1276: 	  {if_3c,			       	%Invalid use of defined/1.
 1277: 	   <<"-if defined(42).\n"
 1278: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1279: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1280: 
 1281: 	  {if_4c,
 1282: 	   <<"-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n">>,
 1283: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1284: 
 1285: 	  {if_5c,
 1286: 	   <<"-ifdef(not_defined_today).\n"
 1287: 	     "-else.\n"
 1288: 	     "-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n"
 1289: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1290: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1291: 
 1292: 	  {if_6c,
 1293: 	   <<"-if(defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1294: 	     "-else.\n"
 1295: 	     "-elif(true).\n"
 1296: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1297: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,elif_after_else}],[]}},
 1298: 
 1299: 	  {if_7c,
 1300: 	   <<"-if(begin true end).\n"		%Not a guard expression.
 1301: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1302: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1303: 
 1304: 	  {if_8c,
 1305: 	   <<"-if(?foo).\n"                     %Undefined symbol.
 1306: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1307: 	   {errors,[{{1,25},epp,{undefined,foo,none}}],[]}},
 1308: 
 1309: 	  {if_9c,
 1310: 	   <<"-if(not_builtin()).\n"
 1311: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1312: 	     "-else.\n"
 1313: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1314: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1315: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}}
 1316: 	 ],
 1317:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1318: 
 1319:     Ts = [{if_1,
 1320: 	   <<"-if(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1321: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1322: 	     "-else.\n"
 1323: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1324: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1325:            ok},
 1326: 
 1327: 	  {if_2,
 1328: 	   <<"-if(false).\n"
 1329: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1330: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1331: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1332: 	     "-else.\n"
 1333: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1334: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1335:            ok},
 1336: 
 1337: 	  {if_3,
 1338: 	   <<"-if(true).\n"
 1339: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1340: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1341: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1342: 	     "-else.\n"
 1343: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1344: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1345:            ok},
 1346: 
 1347: 	  {if_4,
 1348: 	   <<"-define(a, 1).\n"
 1349: 	     "-if(defined(a) andalso defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1350: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1351: 	     "-else.\n"
 1352: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1353: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1354:            ok},
 1355: 
 1356: 	  {if_5,
 1357: 	   <<"-if(defined(a)).\n"
 1358: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1359: 	     "-else.\n"
 1360: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1361: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1362:            ok},
 1363: 
 1364: 	  {if_6,
 1365: 	   <<"-if(defined(not_defined_today)).\n"
 1366: 	     " -if(true).\n"
 1367: 	     "  bug1.\n"
 1368: 	     " -elif(true).\n"
 1369: 	     "  bug2.\n"
 1370: 	     " -elif(true).\n"
 1371: 	     "  bug3.\n"
 1372: 	     " -else.\n"
 1373: 	     "  bug4.\n"
 1374: 	     " -endif.\n"
 1375: 	     "-else.\n"
 1376: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1377: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1378:            ok},
 1379: 
 1380: 	  {if_7,
 1381: 	   <<"-if(42).\n"			%Not boolean.
 1382: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1383: 	     "-else.\n"
 1384: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1385: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1386: 	   ok}
 1387: 	 ],

 1389:

 1392: %% Advanced test on overloading macros.
 1393: overload_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1394:     Cs = [
 1395:           %% '-undef' removes all definitions of a macro
 1396:           {overload_mac_c1,
 1397:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1398:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1399:             "-undef(A).\n"
 1400:             "t1() -> ?A.\n",
 1401:             "t2() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1402:            {errors,[{{4,10},epp,{undefined,'A', none}},
 1403:                     {{5,10},epp,{undefined,'A', 1}}],[]}},
 1404: 
 1405:           %% cannot overload predefined macros
 1406:           {overload_mac_c2,
 1407:            <<"\n-define(MODULE(X), X).">>,
 1408:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'MODULE'}}],[]}},
 1409: 
 1410:           %% cannot overload macros with same arity
 1411:           {overload_mac_c3,
 1412:            <<"-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1413:             "-define(A(Y), Y).">>,
 1414:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine,'A'}}],[]}},
 1415: 
 1416:           {overload_mac_c4,
 1417:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1418:             "-define(A(X,Y), {X,Y}).\n"
 1419:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1420:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1421:            {errors,[{{4,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}}
 1422:          ],
 1423:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1424: 
 1425:     Ts = [
 1426:           {overload_mac_r1,
 1427:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1428:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1429:             "-define(A(X, Y), {X, Y}).\n"
 1430:             "t() -> {?A, ?A(2), ?A(3, 4)}.">>,
 1431:            {1, 2, {3, 4}}},
 1432: 
 1433:           {overload_mac_r2,
 1434:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1435:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1436:             "t() -> ?A(?A).">>,
 1437:            1},
 1438: 
 1439:           {overload_mac_r3,
 1440:            <<"-define(A, ?B).\n"
 1441:             "-define(B, a).\n"
 1442:             "-define(B(X), {b,X}).\n"
 1443:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1444:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1445:            1}
 1446:           ],
 1447:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 1448:

 1450: %% OTP-8388. More tests on overloaded macros.
 1451: otp_8388(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1452:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1453:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8388.erl"),
 1454:     ok = file:write_file(File, <<"-module(otp_8388)."
 1455:                                        "-define(LINE, a).">>),
 1456:     fun() ->
 1457:             PreDefMacros = [{'LINE', a}],
 1458:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1459:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1460:     end(),
 1461: 
 1462:     fun() ->
 1463:             PreDefMacros = ['LINE'],
 1464:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1465:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1466:     end(),
 1467: 
 1468:     Ts = [
 1469:           {macro_1,
 1470:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1471:              "t() -> ?m(,).\n">>,
 1472:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1473:           {macro_2,
 1474:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1475:              "t() -> ?m(a,).\n">>,
 1476:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1477:           {macro_3,
 1478:            <<"\n-define(LINE, a).\n">>,
 1479:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}}],[]}},
 1480:           {macro_4,
 1481:            <<"-define(A(B, C, D), {B,C,D}).\n"
 1482:              "t() -> ?A(a,,3).\n">>,
 1483:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}},
 1484:           {macro_5,
 1485:            <<"-define(Q, {?F0(), ?F1(,,4)}).\n">>,
 1486:            {errors,[{{1,40},epp,{arg_error,'F1'}}],[]}},
 1487:           {macro_6,
 1488:            <<"-define(FOO(X), ?BAR(X)).\n"
 1489:              "-define(BAR(X), ?FOO(X)).\n"
 1490:              "-undef(FOO).\n"
 1491:              "test() -> ?BAR(1).\n">>,
 1492:            {errors,[{{4,12},epp,{undefined,'FOO',1}}],[]}}
 1493:          ],
 1494:     [] = compile(Config, Ts),
 1495:     ok.

 1520: %% OTP-8911. -file and file inclusion bug.
 1521: otp_8911(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1522:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1523: 	true ->
 1524: 	    {skip, "Testing cover, so cannot run when cover is already running"};
 1525: 	false ->
 1526: 	    do_otp_8911(Config)
 1527:     end.
 1528: do_otp_8911(Config) ->
 1529:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1530:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1531: 
 1532:     File = "i.erl",
 1533:     Cont = <<"-module(i).
 1534:               -export([t/0]).
 1535:               -file(\"fil1\", 100).
 1536:               -include(\"i1.erl\").
 1537:               t() ->
 1538:                   a.
 1539:            ">>,
 1540:     ok = file:write_file(File, Cont),
 1541:     Incl = <<"-file(\"fil2\", 35).
 1542:               t1() ->
 1543:                   b.
 1544:            ">>,
 1545:     File1 = "i1.erl",
 1546:     ok = file:write_file(File1, Incl),
 1547: 
 1548:     {ok, i} = cover:compile(File),
 1549:     a = i:t(),
 1550:     {ok,[{{i,6},1}]} = cover:analyse(i, calls, line),
 1551:     cover:stop(),
 1552: 
 1553:     file:delete(File),
 1554:     file:delete(File1),
 1555:     file:set_cwd(CWD),
 1556:     ok.
 1557:

 1563:          ],

 1565:     ok.

 1567: %% OTP-10302. Unicode characters scanner/parser.
 1568: otp_10302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1569:     %% Two messages (one too many). Keeps otp_4871 happy.
 1570:     Cs = [{otp_10302,
 1571:            <<"%% coding: utf-8\n \n \x{E4}">>,
 1572:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,cannot_parse},
 1573:                     {{3,1},file_io_server,invalid_unicode}],[]}}
 1574:          ],
 1575:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1576:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1577:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_10302.erl"),
 1578:     utf8 = encoding("coding: utf-8", File),
 1579:     utf8 = encoding("coding: UTF-8", File),
 1580:     latin1 = encoding("coding: Latin-1", File),
 1581:     latin1 = encoding("coding: latin-1", File),
 1582:     none = encoding_com("coding: utf-8", File),
 1583:     none = encoding_com("\n\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1584:     none = encoding_nocom("\n\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1585:     utf8 = encoding_com("\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1586:     utf8 = encoding_nocom("\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1587:     none = encoding("coding: \nutf-8", File),
 1588:     latin1 = encoding("Encoding :  latin-1", File),
 1589:     utf8 = encoding("ccoding: UTF-8", File),
 1590:     utf8 = encoding("coding= utf-8", File),
 1591:     utf8 = encoding_com(" %% coding= utf-8", File),
 1592:     utf8 = encoding("coding  =  utf-8", File),
 1593:     none = encoding("coding: utf-16 coding: utf-8", File), %first is bad
 1594:     none = encoding("Coding: utf-8", File),    %capital c
 1595:     utf8 = encoding("-*- coding: utf-8 -*-", File),
 1596:     utf8 = encoding("-*-coding= utf-8-*-", File),
 1597:     utf8 = encoding("codingcoding= utf-8", File),
 1598:     ok = prefix("coding: utf-8", File, utf8),
 1599: 
 1600:     "coding: latin-1" = epp:encoding_to_string(latin1),
 1601:     "coding: utf-8" = epp:encoding_to_string(utf8),
 1602:     true = lists:member(epp:default_encoding(), [latin1, utf8]),
 1603: 
 1604:     ok.
 1605: 
 1606: prefix(S, File, Enc) ->
 1607:     prefix(0, S, File, Enc).
 1608: 
 1609: prefix(100, _S, _File, _) ->
 1610:     ok;
 1611: prefix(N, S, File, Enc) ->
 1612:     Enc = encoding(lists:duplicate(N, $\s) ++ S, File),
 1613:     prefix(N+1, S, File, Enc).
 1614: 
 1615: encoding(Enc, File) ->
 1616:     E = encoding_com("%% " ++ Enc, File),
 1617:     none = encoding_com(Enc, File),
 1618:     E = encoding_nocom(Enc, File).
 1619: 
 1620: encoding_com(Enc, File) ->
 1621:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1622:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B),
 1623:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1624:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1625:     E = epp:set_encoding(Fd),
 1626:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1627:     E = epp:read_encoding(File).
 1628: 
 1629: encoding_nocom(Enc, File) ->
 1630:     Options = [{in_comment_only, false}],
 1631:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1632:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B, Options),
 1633:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1634:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1635:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1636:     E = epp:read_encoding(File, Options).
 1637: 
 1638: %% OTP-10820. Unicode filenames.
 1639: otp_10820(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1640:     L = [915,953,959,973,957,953,954,959,957,964],
 1641:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1642:     File = filename:join(Dir, L++".erl"),
 1643:     C1 = <<"%% coding: utf-8\n -module(any).">>,
 1644:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1645:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "unicode"]),
 1646:     C2 = <<"\n-module(any).">>,
 1647:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1648:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "unicode"]).
 1649: 
 1650: do_otp_10820(File, C, PC) ->
 1651:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"] ++ PC),
 1652:     ok = rpc:call(Node, file, write_file, [File, C]),
 1653:     {ok, Forms} = rpc:call(Node, epp, parse_file, [File, [],[]]),
 1654:     [{attribute,1,file,{File,1}},
 1655:      {attribute,2,module,any},
 1656:      {eof,2}] = unopaque_forms(Forms),
 1657:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1658:     ok.
 1659: 
 1660: %% OTP_14285: Unicode atoms.
 1661: otp_14285(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1662:     %% This is just a sample of errors.
 1663:     Cs = [{otp_14285,
 1664:            <<"-export([f/0]).
 1665:               -define('a\x{400}b', 'a\x{400}d').
 1666:               f() ->
 1667:                   ?'a\x{400}b'.
 1668:               g() ->
 1669:                   ?\"a\x{400}b\".
 1670:               h() ->
 1671:                   ?'a\x{400}no'().
 1672:               "/utf8>>,
 1673:            {errors,[{{6,20},epp,{call,[63,[91,["97",44,"1024",44,"98"],93]]}},
 1674:                     {{8,20},epp,{undefined,'a\x{400}no',0}}],
 1675:             []}}
 1676:          ],
 1677:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1678:     ok.
 1679: 
 1680: %% OTP-11728. Bugfix circular macro.
 1681: otp_11728(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1682:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1683:     H = <<"-define(MACRO,[[]++?MACRO]).">>,
 1684:     HrlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.hrl"),
 1685:     ok = file:write_file(HrlFile, H),
 1686:     C = <<"-module(otp_11728).
 1687:            -export([function_name/0]).
 1688: 
 1689:            -include(\"otp_11728.hrl\").
 1690: 
 1691:            function_name()->
 1692:                A=?MACRO, % line 7
 1693:                ok">>,
 1694:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.erl"),
 1695:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C),
 1696:     {ok, L} = epp:parse_file(ErlFile, [Dir], []),
 1697:     true = lists:member({error,{7,epp,{circular,'MACRO',none}}}, L),
 1698:     _ = file:delete(HrlFile),
 1699:     _ = file:delete(ErlFile),
 1700:     ok.
 1701: 
 1702: %% Check the new API for setting the default encoding.
 1703: encoding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1704:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1705:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "encoding.erl"),
 1706: 
 1707:     %% Try a latin-1 file with no encoding given.
 1708:     C1 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1709:            %% ",246,"
 1710: 	  ">>,
 1711:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C1),
 1712:     {ok,[{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
 1713: 	 {attribute,{1,2},module,encoding},
 1714: 	 {error,_},
 1715: 	 {error,{{2,12},epp,cannot_parse}},
 1716: 	 {eof,{2,12}}]} = epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{location, {1,1}}]),
 1717:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1718: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1719: 	 {eof,3}]} =
 1720: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1721:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1722: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1723: 	 {eof,3}],Extra0} =
 1724: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1725:     none = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra0),
 1726: 
 1727:     %% Try a latin-1 file with encoding given in a comment.
 1728:     C2 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1729:            %% encoding: latin-1
 1730:            %% ",246,"
 1731: 	  ">>,
 1732:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C2),
 1733:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1734: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1735: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1736: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, []),
 1737:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1738: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1739: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1740: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1741:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1742: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1743: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1744: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8}]),
 1745:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1746: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1747: 	 {eof,4}],Extra1} =
 1748: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [extra]),
 1749:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra1),
 1750: 
 1751:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1752: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1753: 	 {eof,4}],Extra2} =
 1754: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1755:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra2),
 1756:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1757: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1758: 	 {eof,4}],Extra3} =
 1759: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8},extra]),
 1760:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra3),
 1761:     ok.

 1763: extends(Config) ->

 1768:

 1770: 	   <<"-extends(some_other_module).\n"

 1772: 	   {some_other_module,"some_other_module"}}],
 1773:

 1777: function_macro(Config) ->
 1778:     Cs = [{f_c1,
 1779: 	   <<"-define(FUNCTION_NAME, a).\n"
 1780: 	     "-define(FUNCTION_ARITY, a).\n"
 1781: 	     "-define(FS,\n"
 1782: 	     " atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ \"/\" ++\n"
 1783: 	     " integer_to_list(?FUNCTION_ARITY)).\n"
 1784: 	     "-attr({f,?FUNCTION_NAME}).\n"
 1785: 	     "-attr2(?FS).\n"
 1786: 	     "-file(?FUNCTION_ARITY, 1).\n"
 1787: 	     "f1() ?FUNCTION_NAME/?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1788: 	     "f2(?FUNCTION_NAME.\n">>,
 1789: 	   {errors,[{{1,28},epp,{redefine_predef,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1790: 		    {{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}},
 1791: 		    {{6,11},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1792: 		    {{7,9},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1793: 		    {{8,8},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}},
 1794: 		    {{9,7},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","f1"]},
 1795: 		    {{10,18},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}],
 1796: 	    []}},
 1797: 
 1798: 	  {f_c2,
 1799: 	   <<"a({a) -> ?FUNCTION_NAME.\n"
 1800: 	     "b(}{) -> ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1801: 	     "c(?FUNCTION_NAME, ?not_defined) -> ok.\n">>,
 1802: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","')'"]},
 1803: 		    {{2,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'}'"]},
 1804: 		    {{3,20},epp,{undefined,not_defined,none}}],
 1805: 	    []}},
 1806: 
 1807: 	  {f_c3,
 1808: 	   <<"?FUNCTION_NAME() -> ok.\n"
 1809: 	     "?FUNCTION_ARITY() -> ok.\n">>,
 1810: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal_function_usage,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1811: 		    {{2,2},epp,{illegal_function_usage,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}}],
 1812: 	    []}}
 1813: 	 ],
 1814: 
 1815:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1816: 
 1817:     Ts = [{f_1,
 1818: 	   <<"t() -> {a,0} = a(), {b,1} = b(1), {c,2} = c(1, 2),\n"
 1819: 	     "  {d,1} = d({d,1}), {foo,1} = foo(foo), ok.\n"
 1820: 	     "a() -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1821: 	     "b(_) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1822: 	     "c(_, (_)) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1823: 	     "d({?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}=F) -> F.\n"
 1824: 	     "-define(FOO, foo).\n"
 1825: 	     "?FOO(?FOO) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n">>,
 1826: 	   ok},
 1827: 
 1828: 	  {f_2,
 1829: 	   <<"t() ->\n"
 1830:              "  A = {a,[<<0:24>>,#{a=>1,b=>2}]},\n"
 1831: 	     "  1 = a(A),\n"
 1832: 	     "  ok.\n"
 1833: 	     "a({a,[<<_,_,_>>,#{a:=1,b:=2}]}) -> ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n">>,
 1834: 	   ok},
 1835: 
 1836: 	  {f_3,
 1837: 	   <<"-define(FS,\n"
 1838: 	     " atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ \"/\" ++\n"
 1839: 	     " integer_to_list(?FUNCTION_ARITY)).\n"
 1840: 	     "t() ->\n"
 1841: 	     "  {t,0} = {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY},\n"
 1842: 	     "  \"t/0\" = ?FS,\n"
 1843: 	     "  ok.\n">>,
 1844: 	   ok},
 1845: 
 1846: 	  {f_4,
 1847: 	   <<"-define(__, _, _).\n"
 1848: 	     "-define(FF, ?FUNCTION_NAME, ?FUNCTION_ARITY).\n"
 1849: 	     "a(?__) -> 2 = ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1850: 	     "b(?FUNCTION_ARITY, ?__) -> ok.\n"
 1851: 	     "c(?FF) -> ok.\n"
 1852: 	     "t() -> a(1, 2), b(3, 1, 2), c(c, 2), ok.\n">>,
 1853: 	   ok}
 1854: 	 ],
 1855:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1856: 
 1857:     ok.
 1858: 
 1859: source_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1860:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1861:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
 1862: 
 1863:     source_name_1(File, "/test/gurka.erl"),
 1864:     source_name_1(File, "gaffel.erl"),
 1865: 
 1866:     ok.
 1867: 
 1868: source_name_1(File, Expected) ->
 1869:     Res = epp:parse_file(File, [{source_name, Expected}]),
 1870:     {ok, [{attribute,_,file,{Expected,_}} | _Forms]} = Res.
 1871: 
 1872: otp_16978(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1873:     %% A test of erl_parse:tokens().
 1874:     P = <<"t() -> ?a.">>,
 1875:     Vs = [#{},
 1876:           #{k => 1,[[a],[{}]] => "str"},
 1877:           #{#{} => [{#{x=>#{3=>$3}}},{3.14,#{}}]}],
 1878:     Ts = [{erl_parse_tokens,
 1879:            P,
 1880:            [{d,{a,V}}],
 1881:            V} || V <- Vs],
 1882:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1883: 
 1884:     ok.

 2097:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{bad,warning}}],[]}},
 2098: 
 2099:           {otp_16824_50,
 2100:            <<"\n-warning">>,
 2101:            {errors,[{{2,2},epp,{bad,warning}}],[]}}
 2102: 
 2103:           ],
 2104:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 2105:     ok.
 2106: 
 2107: gh_8268(Config) ->
 2108:     Ts = [{circular_1,
 2109:            <<"-define(LOG(Tag, Code), io:format(\"~s\", [Tag]), Code).
 2110:              more_work() -> ok.
 2111:              some_work() -> ok.
 2112:              t() ->
 2113:                 ?LOG(work,
 2114:                      begin
 2115:                         maybe
 2116:                            ok ?= some_work()
 2117:                         end,
 2118:                         more_work()
 2119:                      end).
 2120:              ">>,
 2121:            [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}],
 2122:            ok}],
 2123:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2124:     ok.
 2125: 
 2126: stringify(Config) ->
 2127:     Ts = [{stringify_1,
 2128:            ~"""
 2129:             -define(S(S), ??S).
 2130:             t() ->
 2131:                 ~S('атом') = ?S('атом'),
 2132:                 ~S("атом") = ?S("атом"),
 2133:                 ok.
 2134:             """,
 2135:            [],
 2136:            ok}],
 2137:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2138:     ok.
 2139: 
 2140: %% Start location is 1.
 2141: check(Config, Tests) ->
 2142:     eval_tests(Config, fun check_test/3, Tests).
 2143: 
 2144: %% Start location is {1,1}.
 2145: compile(Config, Tests) ->
 2146:     eval_tests(Config, fun compile_test/3, Tests).
 2147: 
 2148: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2149:     eval_tests(Config, fun run_test/3, Tests).
 2150: 
 2151: eval_tests(Config, Fun, Tests) ->
 2152:     TestsWithOpts =
 2153:         [case Test of
 2154:              {N,P,E} ->
 2155:                  {N,P,[],E};
 2156:              {_,_,_,_} ->
 2157:                  Test
 2158:          end || Test <- Tests],
 2159:     F = fun({N,P,Opts,E}, BadL) ->
 2160:                 %% io:format("Testing ~p~n", [P]),
 2161:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, Opts),
 2162:                 %% The result should be the same when enabling maybe ... end
 2163:                 %% (making 'else' a keyword instead of an atom).
 2164:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}|Opts]),
 2165:                 case message_compare(E, Return) of
 2166:                     true ->
 2167:                         case E of
 2168:                             {errors, Errors} ->
 2169:                                 call_format_error(Errors);
 2170:                             _ ->
 2171:                                 ok
 2172:                         end,
 2173:                         BadL;
 2174:                     false ->
 2175:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2176:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Return]),
 2177: 			fail()
 2178:                 end
 2179:         end,
 2180:     lists:foldl(F, [], TestsWithOpts).
 2181: 
 2182: check_test(Config, Test, Opts) ->
 2183:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2184:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2185:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2186:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2187:     case epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, PrivDir}| Opts]) of
 2188: 	{ok,Forms} ->
 2189: 	    Errors = [E || E={error,_} <- Forms],
 2190: 	    call_format_error([E || {error,E} <- Errors]),
 2191: 	    Errors;
 2192: 	{error,Error} ->
 2193: 	    Error
 2194:     end.
 2195: 
 2196: compile_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2197:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). ">>, Test0],
 2198:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2199:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2200:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2201:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2202:     Opts = [export_all,nowarn_export_all,return,nowarn_unused_record,{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2203:     case compile_file(File, Opts) of
 2204:         {ok, Ws} -> warnings(File, Ws);
 2205:         {errors, Errors}=Else ->
 2206:             call_format_error(Errors),
 2207:             Else;
 2208:         Else -> Else
 2209:     end.
 2210: 
 2211: warnings(File, Ws) ->
 2212:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 2213:         [] ->
 2214: 	    [];
 2215:         L ->
 2216: 	    call_format_error(L),
 2217: 	    {warnings, L}
 2218:     end.
 2219: 
 2220: compile_file(File, Opts) ->
 2221:     case compile:file(File, Opts) of
 2222:         {ok, _M, Ws} -> {ok, Ws};
 2223:         {error, FEs, []} -> {errors, errs(FEs, File), []};
 2224:         {error, FEs, [{File,Ws}]} -> {error, errs(FEs, File), Ws}
 2225:     end.
 2226: 
 2227: errs([{File,Es}|L], File) ->
 2228:     call_format_error(Es),
 2229:     Es ++ errs(L, File);
 2230: errs([_|L], File) ->
 2231:     errs(L, File);
 2232: errs([], _File) ->
 2233:     [].
 2234: 
 2235: %% Smoke test and coverage of format_error/1.
 2236: call_format_error([{_,M,E}|T]) ->
 2237:     _ = M:format_error(E),
 2238:     call_format_error(T);
 2239: call_format_error([]) ->
 2240:     ok.
 2241: 
 2242: epp_parse_file(File, Opts) ->
 2243:     case epp:parse_file(File, Opts) of
 2244:         {ok, Forms} ->
 2245:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms)};
 2246:         {ok, Forms, Other} ->
 2247:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms), Other}
 2248:     end.
 2249: 
 2250: unopaque_forms(Forms) ->
 2251:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 2252: 
 2253: run_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2254:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). -export([t/0]). ">>, Test0],
 2255:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2256:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2257:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2258:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2259:     Opts = [return, {i,PrivDir},{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2260:     {ok, epp_test, []} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2261:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(File, ".erl"),
 2262: 
 2263:     case lists:member({feature, maybe_expr, enable}, Opts0) of
 2264:         false ->
 2265:             %% Run in node
 2266:             {module, epp_test} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, epp_test),
 2267:             Reply = epp_test:t(),
 2268:             code:purge(epp_test),
 2269:             Reply;
 2270:         true ->
 2271:             %% Run in peer with maybe_expr enabled
 2272:             {ok, Peer, Node} =
 2273:                 ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-enable-feature","maybe_expr"],
 2274:                            connection => 0}),
 2275:             {module, epp_test} =
 2276:                 rpc:call(Node, code, load_abs, [AbsFile, epp_test]),
 2277:             Reply = rpc:call(Node, epp_test, t, []),
 2278:             peer:stop(Peer),
 2279:             Reply
 2280:     end.
 2281: 
 2282: fail() ->
 2283:     ct:fail(failed).
 2284: 
 2285: message_compare(T, T) ->
 2286:     T =:= T.
